info.name: Cuneate nucleus
info.description: The cuneate nucleus contains the second-order neurons that receive tactile, vibratory and proprioceptive input from the upper extremity and the body above T6 via the cuneate fasciculus of the spinal cord. The axons of these cuneate neurons decussate in the medulla to form the medial lemniscus which will travel to and synapse in the ventral posterior lateral nucleus of the thalamus.
info.item: /Sections/Thin, Whole Brain/Sagittal & Parasagittal/3 Sag Thin Sec
